newsitem.title: ITALY: BAA signs deal for Naples airport stake.
newsitem.headline: BAA signs deal for Naples airport stake.

text.p: The British Airport Authority (BAA) signed a preliminary accord with local southern Italian authorities on Friday to take a 70 percent stake in Gesac, the company which operates Naples Capodichino airport.
An official for the local council said BAA would pay between 46.9 billion lire and 56 billion lire ($27.5-32.9 million) for the majority holding.
He added that the deal still had to be cleared by both the regional and local assemblies in Naples.
Friday's accord was signed by BAA Director General John Egan, the mayor of Naples, Antonio Bassolino, and the chairman of the local province Amato Lamberti.
